messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] testing only
messages.msgSnippet: Thanks for the info, Bob. You mentioned Yasutoshi but I don t believe you mentioned it being in Slough s book. I ll have to check that out. I may be using the
messages.messageBody:
Thanks for the info, Bob. You mentioned Yasutoshi but I don't believe you mentioned it being in Slough's book. I'll have to check that out.

I may be using the sample sometime in the near future. I'm doing a one-case display at our downtown Soldiers Memorial museum this summer. Inspecting it for the first time the other day and talking to the director, he asked if I would be interested in doing a talk for a city "rich man's club" organization. A little out of my league (and the director's), I said yes. It would be a good opportunity to show the tamahagane. If nothing happens in the near future, I'll get the sample back to you.

Ron


----- Original Message -----
From: Bob Elder
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, June 15, 2004 9:26 AM
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] testing only


Hi Ron. Couldn't remember if I told you but the
tamahagane I sent you is from Yasutoshi and is
pictured in John Slough's book on pages 192/193. I
have video of that visit where he showed us a part if
the process up to the first few folds. Anyway, Bob
Elder


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
